item.title: Calls to ban machetes as elderly Territorians terrorised in their own homes

item.title: Outback businesses raise concerns about Services Australia's Centrepay reforms
item.description: Business owners worry major changes to a buy now, pay later system used by about 500,000 social security recipients will cause a raft of issues when it begins next month.

item.title: AFL trade period, day one: Essendon firm on Zach Merrett as Carlton set to play hardball with Charlie Curnow
item.description: Essendon once again firmly states that captain Zach Merrett will not leave the Bombers as all 18 clubs begin the wheeling and dealing on the first day of the AFL's trade period.

item.title: Mount Everest rescue underway after snowstorm traps hundreds of trekkers in Tibet
item.description: Local villagers and rescue teams help hikers stranded on Mount Everest after a snowstorm pummels the Himalayas.

item.title: Search underway for 76-year-old Tasmanian man missing near Hollybank
item.description: The man has not been seen since he was searching for his car in dense bushland in northern Tasmania on Sunday afternoon.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Defiant Ange Postecoglou says he will fight back as Nottingham Forest lose again
item.description: Ange Postecoglou fires up in a post-match press conference after Nottingham Forest lose to Newcastle United 2-0.

item.title: Clients of Melbourne builder MJ Harris Group lose life savings as company goes bust
item.description: More than a dozen customers of MJ Harris Group have told the ABC they have been left significantly out of pocket after the company went into liquidation this week.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump from deploying National Guard troops to Oregon
item.description: A federal judge temporarily blocks Donald Trump from deploying Californian National Guard troops to Portland, after earlier blocking the US President from mobilising local troops in Oregon.

item.title: Reece Walsh's NRL grand final heroics with Broncos rewarded with Kangaroos call-up
item.description: Recognition of Reece Walsh's breathtaking performance in the NRL grand final continues, with the Brisbane Broncos hero set to make his Test debut for Australia later this month.

item.title: What is task paralysis and how do you overcome it?
item.description: Experts say feeling stuck or frozen when trying to start or complete a task can be the body's response to overwhelm.

item.title: Broncos great Ali Brigginshaw to co-captain Jillaroos after NRLW grand final victory
item.description: Ali Brigginshaw is named as a Jillaroos co-captain after helping steer the Brisbane Broncos to their fourth NRLW premiership.

item.title: As the AFLW begins to even out, North Melbourne remains untouchable
item.description: North Melbourne claims its 20th win in a row as it looks to go undefeated for another season.

item.title: Broncos star Pat Carrigan says a wooden spoon from 2020 helped motivate him for the grand final
item.description: Fans left wooden spoons on Brisbane's training ground in 2020 — it was a move that helped motivate Pat Carrigan to greatness.

item.title: New Zealand pays $5.3 million to Samoa after sinking navy ship Manawanui on pristine reef
item.description: The New Zealand government says it has done "the right thing" in offering a $5.3 million compensation payout to the Samoan government after its navy sunk a ship on a pristine reef off the Pacific island.

item.title: How much are NRL and NRLW premiership rings worth? What do they look like?
item.description: The men's rings are valued at $15,000, while the women's rings have a price tag of $10,000.

item.title: Why Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters is looking to the past ahead of Ashes series
item.description: New Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters was part of an era where the green and gold jersey was the highest honour rugby league could offer and ahead of the return of the Ashes it's a legacy he's desperate to pass down to his players.

item.title: Roosters forward Aliyah Nasio sent to judiciary over NRLW grand final brawl
item.description: Sydney Roosters forward Aliyah Nasio is facing a ban for throwing a punch in the brawl at the conclusion of the NRLW grand final.

item.title: Marnus Labuschagne hands Ashes selectors reminder with Sheffield Shield century
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne has hit his first century in red ball cricket for over a year just one month out from the first Ashes Test.

item.title: Dead hikers yet to be identified as locals warn of High Country danger
item.description: Locals in Victoria's High Country are warning visitors about the unpredictable conditions in the alpine region, after the bodies of two women were discovered near Falls Creek.

item.title: Homeschool registrations are rising and policy needs to catch up
item.description: Primary school homeschooling registrations in Queensland grew by 110 per cent from 2021 to 2025.

item.title: Australia and Papua New Guinea sign landmark alliance vowing to defend each other in conflict
item.description: PNG and Australia formally sign a landmark new defence treaty, elevating the bilateral relationship between the two countries to an alliance and agreeing to "act to meet the common danger" if the other is attacked.

item.title: Broncos shares surge 40 per cent after Grand Final win
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: York family honours late son with tractor museum to fund cancer research
item.description: Oliver Crane was diagnosed with bone cancer and died at age 17. This week, his family opened a vintage tractor museum in his memory to help raise money for cancer research.

item.title: Timothy Hunt convicted of murdering Tony Rowe after month-long Supreme Court trial
item.description: Darwin man Timothy Hunt has been convicted of murdering Tony Rowe, whose remains were found on the city's outskirts in May 2023, one year after he was reported missing.

item.title: Newcastle Yowies' dual glory in 2025 Koori Knockout rugby league finals
item.description: Yowies playmaker Kyle Laybutt kicks a mammoth field goal to seal victory in the men's final, while the Yowies women keep a clean sheet in their grand final.

item.title: England's 2003 Rugby World Cup winner Lewis Moody reveals MND diagnosis
item.description: Lewis Moody, a former England rugby captain who helped his side win the 2003 World Cup, has been diagnosed with Motor Neurone Disease.

item.title: Whakaari eruption inquest hears from frustrated families calling for answers
item.description: A close family member of a tour guide who died in the Whakaari White Island eruption in 2019 has given an emotional statement as the inquest into the tragedy continues.

item.title: Greta Thunberg deported as Australian flotilla activists detained by Israel allege physical abuse
item.description: Climate campaigner Greta Thunberg and more than 100 activists from the Gaza aid flotilla have been deported to Greece and Slovakia, Israel says.

item.title: Papua New Guinea may sit out potential conflict between Australia and China despite Pukpuk defence treaty
item.description: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister James Marape says there is a "high possibility" the country would not enter a conflict involving Australia and China, despite having signed a mutual defence treaty with its southern neighbour.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Losing Streak
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: Perth Royal Show attendance slumps to eight-year low
item.description: Attendance at this year's Perth Royal Show has hit an eight-year low, as organisers blame "heavy downpours" amid complaints from vendors about a lack of support.

item.title: English author Jilly Cooper, writer of The Rutshire Chronicles, dies at age 88
item.description: The author was best known for The Rutshire Chronicles, including the novel Rivals, which was recently adapted into a Disney+ series.

item.title: Trio of scientists win Nobel Prize in Medicine for 'discoveries concerning peripheral immune tolerance'
item.description: The Nobel Prize for Medicine has been given to three scientists for discovering how our immune systems protect us from microbes.

item.title: At least 63 people killed in Indonesia school collapse disaster in Java
item.description: The number of people killed in the disaster could still rise, with some half a dozen children still unaccounted for.

item.title: TasTAFE to remove subsidy for lab training, design, media and courses that 'don't align with jobs market'
item.description: Tasmanian TAFE graduates worry as some locally taught courses that helped them forge a career may disappear as the cost to study them increases dramatically.

item.title: Two years since Gaza war began, some Israelis feel 'reckoning' is coming
item.description: After two years of war, a fractured but defiant Israel is struggling to assert itself at home and abroad.

item.title: New data shows Australia's extreme weather losses among highest in world
item.description: Amid more extreme weather events, parametric insurance — described as a bet on the weather —is on the rise. It is now being touted as a possible solution for Australians, who have some of the highest insurance losses in the world.

item.title: Sussan Ley cites trans offender case in argument for minimum jail terms for child exploitation crimes
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley raises the case of a trans child abuser as she seeks to pressure the Albanese government to create mandatory minimum jail terms for child exploitation offences.

item.title: Telcos face Canberra grilling as Triple Zero Custodian legislation is set to be introduced
item.description: New legislation will be introduced to enshrine the powers of the Triple Zero Custodian into law.

item.title: Sole survivor of Bochara fatal crash was behind the wheel, coroner rules
item.description: A coroner determines that the sole survivor of a crash that killed four people at Bochara was behind the wheel during the incident.

item.title: What the future holds for Sydney's former psychiatric hospital sites with storied pasts
item.description: The challenge of transforming a major piece of Sydney's public space from a former mental health hospital to an "iconic urban parkland" is a delicate dance for the state government.

item.title: Expert cautions people using AI as search for missing boy in SA outback scaled back
item.description: Users have reported Facebook's AI search has shown incorrect information about four-year-old Gus who remains missing in SA's outback.

item.title: Victorian couple sues Barwon Health over delayed diagnosis of rare 'flesh-eating disease' necrotising fasciitis
item.description: A young father who lost his eye after contracting a rare infection is suing the hospital that treated him, alleging it ignored his requests to investigate his condition properly.

item.title: Songbird heard for first time since 1890s in WA park
item.description: The song of the noisy scrub-bird is being heard in WA's West Cape Howe National Park again, bringing joy to bird enthusiasts everywhere.

item.title: Bulk-billing rates remain low as GPs spend longer with patients, survey finds
item.description: An industry survey finds GPs are managing conditions typically handled by specialists due to high costs and only 12 per cent can afford to bulk-bill all patients.

item.title: Singapore PM Lawrence Wong signals 'shared interests' with Australia and desire to expand military ties
item.description: Singapore wants to expand its military ties with Australia, including through a greater Australian troop presence in the island state as part of an upgraded trade and defence relationship, according to Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: Drought conditions forcing kangaroo mobs to descend on farms, consuming scarce resources
item.description: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

item.title: Darwin ship lift project cost blowout rivalling Snowy 2.0, economist says
item.description: It’s taken 10 years, blown out by hundreds of millions of dollars, and is still nowhere near becoming operational. Now there are calls for the Darwin ship lift project to be scrapped.

item.title: Wildlife photographer Rob Blakers pleads guilty to trespassing on Robbins Island
item.description: Wildlife photographer Rob Blakers pleads guilty to trespassing after admitting he camped beyond the boundary line whilst visiting privately owned Robbins Island to observe migratory birds.

item.title: Daria Kasatkina ends 2025 tennis season early, citing burnout
item.description: Daria Kasatkina ends her 2025 WTA season early, citing the hectic schedule and a high-stress year after switching nationalities to Australia from Russia.

item.title: Bayer announces Roundup alternative with rollout of new weedkiller in Australia
item.description: We've been spraying it on our farms, gardens and roadsides for 50 years, but the world's most used weedkiller is starting to run out of steam.

item.description: With more than 200,000 people expected to attend this weekend's Bathurst 1000, the family of Janine Vaughan wants a billboard raising awareness about her disappearance uncovered.

item.title: New WA program aims to improve access to childcare for children with disabilities
item.description: An Australian-first pilot program gets underway in WA in the hope of not only giving the parents of children with complex needs a break, but helping them navigate the maze of different support systems.

item.description: A 24-year-old woman who claims to be Madeleine McCann is on trial charged with stalking the missing child's parents over the past three years.

item.title: Search for missing man Peter Willoughby, 76, continues in Tasmanian bushland
item.description: Mounted crews and drones are now involved in the search for Peter Willoughby, 76, who became disoriented and walked off into dense bushland near Launceston, police say.

item.description: The reported attempts to lure Nick Daicos away from Collingwood have headlined the second day of the AFL trade period. Look back at how all the day's trade news unfolded in our blog.

item.description: The floodwaters that have created an expansive inland oasis on the usually arid salt beds of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre have reached a peak, and are beginning to evaporate, a local pilot says.

item.description: With the help of Mystery Road: Origin's steely detective Jay Swan, an all-Indigenous writing team tackles one of Australia's biggest issues.

item.description: Political leaders have condemned the painting of a pro-Hamas slogan on a Melbourne billboard as Australia's Jewish community commemorates the October 7 terrorist attack.

item.description: Farmers are close to abandoning the dream of a food bowl in northern Australia, as one expert warns the region is nearing its "thermal limits" for cropping and cattle.

item.description: Loneliness is rising fastest among Canberrans in their 30s and 40s, with new research showing this cohort is now more likely than younger people to report feeling lonely in the ACT.

item.description: Neighbours fans rush to Melbourne op shops after 40 years of props, furniture and Ramsay Street relics were donated to charities.

item.description: Police say they have conducted a "significant" aerial search of a property in South Australia's mid-north, where a four-year-old boy went missing 10 days ago.

item.description: Western Sydney University has apologised to current and former students who received emails claiming their degrees have been "revoked", saying the messages are "not legitimate".

item.description: Parents in the NT who frequently fail to send their children to school, without a valid reason, may have their income managed by the Commonwealth.

item.description: The 60-year-old accused of shooting at over a dozen random members of the public in suburban Sydney has faced a magistrate after two lawyers got into an argument over who was representing him.

item.description: Darren Lehmann and Glenn McGrath will join a first-class line-up of cricket talent for ABC Sport's coverage of the Ashes.

item.title: South Australia declared free from brown rugose fruit virus after more than a year

item.title: Emmanuel Macron urged by his first PM to resign in escalating French crisis
item.description: Emmanuel Macron's first prime minister urges the cornered French head of state to resign in a shock call that compounded an escalating political crisis.

item.description: Iris Stalzer, a Social Democrat who was elected mayor of Herdecke in the Ruhr region a week ago, is reportedly suffered life-threatening injuries.

item.title: Research shows females carry a much higher genetic risk for major depression than males
item.description: In a study involving about 200,000 people diagnosed with depression, scientists have identified almost twice as many genetic red flags in the DNA of females compared with males.

item.title: Anika Wells points to surprise stress test of triple-0 network ahead of bushfire season
item.description: The adequacy of Australia's emergency call network will be stress tested with a surprise drill ahead of bushfire season, as the opposition ramps up its assault over the communication minister's handling of last month's fatal triple-0 outage.

item.title: 'Everyday living cost' or assistive technology? NDIS participants frustrated with flexibility of rules

item.title: Tourism operators seek more funding to mitigate algal bloom impact in SA over summer
item.description: Tourism, seafood industry and community representatives are calling for greater funding, education and travel incentives ahead of the release of the South Australian government's upcoming Summer Plan.

item.description: Italian heavyweights AC Milan look set to play a match, for actual Serie A points, in Perth. What will the state government pay to lure them here, and why are some football supporters unhappy?

item.title: Australian dollar jumps to 10-month high against yen, ASX slips as gold price hits new record — as it happened
item.description: The ASX 200 closes slightly down, as gold maintains record highs. The Australian dollar surges against the Japanese yen on speculation that its central bank will delay lifting interest rates. Look back on all the day's business and finance news.

item.title: Surge in shark-tracking app downloads following fatal Sydney attack
item.description: There has been a surge in downloads of the SharkSmart app following the fatal attack of a Northern Beaches surfer — in a sign the incident has left some nervous to get back into the water.

item.title: Players concerned over Shanghai heat as Novak Djokovic collapses on court
item.description: Holger Rune says "there is always a limit" as soaring temperatures and humidity in Shanghai and Wuhan tennis events cause player distress.

item.title: AFL trade period, day three recap: Sam Flanders, Judd McVee and Brandon Starcevich find new homes as Brisbane makes Oscar Allen bid official
item.description: Oscar Allen's move to Brisbane is almost official as West Coast finds out what compensation it would receive for losing its captain. Here's how day three of the AFL trade period panned out.

item.title: Australian merino wool future positive after surging price restores grower confidence
item.description: Amid a run of price rises at Australian wool auctions, the next generation of growers say global demand and fresh confidence could mark a turning point for the fibre.

item.title: Taylor Swift wears Adelaide label Paolo Sebastian in The Fate of Ophelia music video
item.description: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

item.title: Neighbour of Kotoni Staggs pays tribute to Broncos star after supporting family through husband's death
item.description: The neighbour of Kotoni Staggs pays tribute to the Broncos star for helping her through a devastating family death.

item.title: Taylor Swift ‘bejewelled’ in dress made by Aussie fashion designer in new music video
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australians are reading less than ever before. Here's how to read more books
item.description: Research shows Australians are reading fewer books than ever before. One writer shares her advice on how to make reading a daily habit.

item.title: Democrats and Republicans clash in fiery Senate hearing
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pam Bondi accused of using justice system to target Donald Trump's opponents
item.description: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi has faced heated questioning from senators over claims she's transforming the justice department into a "shield for the president and his political allies".

item.title: Arsenal lose 2-1 to Lyon at Women's Champions League as trio of Matildas feature
item.description: Arsenal goes down 2-1 to Lyon in the Women's Champion League as three Matildas stars make an appearance at Meadow Park.

item.title: WA iron ore mining shows no signs of slowing despite price drop concerns
item.description: Australia's two biggest iron ore miners continue to expand their operations in WA's Pilbara, despite warnings of waning demand.

item.title: More families raising children with cystic fibrosis staying in the bush
item.description: Two mums in rural Queensland have spoken about why they choose to live more than 1,000 kilometres from the Queensland Children's Hospital.

item.title: Single farmers in Western Australia ditch dating apps for something face to face
item.description: When the dating app radius won't reach the edge of your property, and you're harvesting grain from sun-up til sundown, how do you find a partner?

item.title: Rental prices have risen almost 44 per cent in five years, Cotality review finds
item.description: Median rental prices have risen to more than $700 per week for the first time, according to Cotality's Quarterly Rental Review.

item.title: Hundreds of court cases potentially compromised amid Victoria Police investigation
item.description: Police have arrested a digital forensics officer and are investigating whether his work compromised hundreds of cases over nearly a decade including sexual offence and child abuse cases.

item.title: Brewer stages beer boycott over Kangaroo Island ferry's 'ridiculous' fares
item.description: A Kangaroo Island brewer says he will no longer supply beer to the island's ferry service, amid a growing outcry over the high cost of fares to the popular international tourism destination.

item.title: WA's Bibbulmun Track running record broken twice in one week
item.description: Two men have smashed the record for completing one of the world's longest walking tracks in the fastest time, within days of each other.

item.title: Minjee Lee eyes top spot in golf's end-of-season rankings race
item.description: Australian superstar Minjee Lee is in line for several big awards as the 2025 golf season enters the home stretch in Asia.

item.title: Glencore refinery sites stay open with taxpayer funds
item.description: The last Australian copper smelter processing third-party product will stay open after its owner accepted a support package.

item.title: Broken Hill nurse to represent Australia at Ironman World Championship — Women
item.description: Broken Hill nurse Bella Kolinac, 23, will represent Australia at the Ironman World Championship — Women in Kona, Hawaii.

item.title: Last night's harvest moon made for stunning photos. When is the next supermoon?
item.description: Stargazers from around the world have captured the luminous glow of October's supermoon.

item.title: Sam Kerr to play for Matildas for the first time in two years
item.description: Sam Kerr's two year absence from the Matildas is almost over, she's set to feature in friendlies later this month, while Mary Fowler is recovering well from her own ACL injury.

item.title: Australian Gaza flotilla member criticises federal government after being detained by Israel
item.description: An Australian activist accuses the federal government of not providing enough support after she and other members of a flotilla were detained by Israel.

item.title: More than 500 hikers reportedly rescued after being stranded on Mount Everest
item.description: Hundreds of trekkers, villagers and support staff have safely reached the Tibetan town of Qudang, according to Chinese state media.

item.title: Geelong Cats fined by AFL over third-party arrangements
item.description: The AFL fines Geelong $77,500 for failing to disclose third-party agreements with players over a six-year period.

item.title: Mark Latham's outburst outside court, as ex-partner pleads not guilty to intimate image charges
item.description: Independent MP Mark Latham has spoken out against former partner Nathalie Matthews during an ongoing legal battle, on the same day she pleaded not guilty to intimate image charges in a separate matter.

item.title: Witness vision of attack on Ecuadorian president's motorcade
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Male whales race in pursuit of female in east coast migration
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Male humpback whales race in pursuit of female during east coast migration
item.description: A drone photographer captures vision of a tightly packed pod of 11 humpback whales heading south in a race to mate off the NSW mid-north coast.

item.title: Surfer bitten by shark chasing seal off Kangaroo Island
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dolly Parton's sister speaks out over singer's health concerns
item.description: Dolly Parton's sister has asked fans to pray for the country music singer's health just one week after the star delayed several concerts in Las Vegas.

item.title: Man spared jail time by ACT court after he raped and filmed woman without consent
item.description: A 38-year-old man has been spared jail time, partly on account of his autism diagnosis, after raping a woman he met online and filming their sexual encounters without consent.

item.title: Optus email mishap left department in dark about triple-0 outage, even after Anika Wells' office told
item.description: The telco operator sent two emails about its outage, which understated its extent, to a departmental email address that had been changed a week earlier.

item.title: NSW Police hold 'significant concerns' about planned pro-Palestinian march to Sydney Opera House
item.description: A senior NSW Police officer has expressed cynicism that a crowd of tens of thousands could be managed in a staggered manner.

item.title: Thousands of flights disrupted as US government shutdown enters its second week
item.description: The US government shutdown is entering its second week and the impacts are starting to play out, with thousands of flights disrupted across the country.

item.title: Ecuadorian protesters filmed throwing rocks in alleged presidential assassination attempt
item.description: Five people have been detained after hundreds of protesters surrounded the presidential motorcade of Daniel Noboa and began throwing rocks and stones.

item.title: Buddhist monk Naotunne Vijitha pleads not guilty to historical child sexual assault charges
item.description: The head monk of a Buddhist temple, Naotunne Vijitha, has denied sexually assaulting six girls at the temple in Melbourne's south-east.

item.title: NSW Police release aerial video of arrest in Revesby
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Childcare director Amanda Vassel fined for employing convicted child sex offender husband
item.description: Amanda Louise Vassel was sacked from her job at the south-east Queensland childcare centre after the matter came to light.

item.title: Alexander O'Sachy sentenced to 11 years in prison for stabbing Angela Godwin to death at their Brisbane home
item.description: The Supreme Court in Brisbane heard Alexander O'Sachy tried to clean up evidence of his crime before calling emergency services.

item.title: City of Stirling terminates football club's lease after player's alleged explicit Stephen Hawking costume
item.description: A Perth football club faces deregistration and has been expelled from their club rooms after a player reportedly attended a post-season party dressed as Stephen Hawking, allegedly with explicit images of himself as a child attached.

item.title: Deported Gaza flotilla activist slams Australian government for lack of support
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Former clinical director Hannah Lake leads Hobart Clinic rescue bid
item.description: The former clinical director of the Hobart Clinic, psychiatrist Dr Hannah Lake, is part of a last-minute push for the institution to be given a reprieve before it closes its doors at the end of next week.

item.title: Melbourne man sentenced over medical cannabis company Cann Group insider trading case
item.description: A Melbourne man found guilty of insider trading during a $20 million capital raise by a medicinal cannabis company has been ordered to pay more than $225,000.

item.title: AFLW Carlton star Darcy Vescio says 'punching down' on Mad Monday must end
item.description: Inaugural Carlton AFLW star Darcy Vescio has urged players to be more conscious of their role-model status when dressing up for end-of-season celebrations.

item.title: Qantas says 'legal protections in place' as cyber hacking group threatens to release personal data
item.description: Qantas says it is continuing to support customers as a hacking group threatens to release personal data from around 40 companies to the dark web.

item.title: Trade restrictions for Philippines banana imports to be reviewed by federal government
item.description: The federal government will review its quarantine rules after a formal request by the Philippines to import its bananas, but the industry is pushing back.

item.title: Bruce Highway diverted in North Queensland as thick smoke threatens visibility
item.description: Queensland Police have diverted traffic off the Bruce Highway south of Proserpine in North Queensland, as fire crews battle a blaze burning close to the road.

item.title: Scramble to protect Kangaroo Island bee colony, one of the world's purest colonies, from varroa mite
item.description: A deadly parasite that has laid waste to bee colonies throughout Australia has so far not made it to Kangaroo Island, home to the world's oldest bee sanctuary.

item.title: Ex-Collingwood player Shannon Cox jailed for killing women in Brand Hwy car crash
item.description: Former Collingwood player Shannon Cox, who had meth is his system when his car smashed into a hatchback, killing two elderly women, is jailed for manslaughter.

item.title: Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium debate weighs 'expert' advice
item.description: Tasmania's minister responsible for the proposed $1.13 billion Macquarie Point stadium, Eric Abetz, says there are many "expert" views, but ultimately the government will decide.

item.title: Strava is suing Garmin for patent infringement. Here's what we know
item.description: Fitness app Strava and sports watchmaker Garmin usually go hand-in-hand, but the two fitness tech leaders are now in competition in a US lawsuit.

item.title: Stephen Miller has said Donald Trump has plenary authority but what does that actually mean?
item.description: A Trump administration official faces criticism after allegedly claiming US President Donald Trump has "plenary authority" while on a live interview with CNN.

item.title: Do dishwashers release microplastics when you wash plastic containers and kitchenware?
item.description: If you're worried about microplastics, is it safe to wash plastic containers and other utensils in the dishwasher, given the use of heat and detergents? We asked two experts.

item.title: Jon Stevens releases new album Shimmer, announces tour on 64th birthday
item.description: From teen idol to rock great, Jon Stevens has fronted legendary bands Noiseworks and INXS. He has chosen his 64th birthday to release a new album and announce a tour.

item.title: Three charged with murder and torture of Brisbane man Andrew Burow
item.description: Police will allege Andrew Burow endured a three to four-day ordeal which began after meeting with the accused in August.

item.title: Former RAAF pilot Robert John Crawford appears in court, charged with murder of wife Frances Crawford
item.description: Robert John Crawford has been charged with murder over the death of his wife at their home in July 2024.

item.title: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport
item.description: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.

item.title: City of Melbourne set to vote on security camera overhaul, surveillance powers for staff
item.description: The City of Melbourne is set to vote on a new plan that would see more privately owned CCTV cameras feeding into the city's security network and staff able to access the footage to investigate local law breaches.

item.title: Australia's parliament is likely to grow for the first time in 40 years
item.description: Australia's parliament is likely to get larger as the government canvasses possibilities for expanding the number of MPs and introducing fixed or four-year terms.

item.title: Algal bloom chief asked about 'disaster' declaration as inquiry told of thousands of marine deaths
item.description: The SA government has never formally requested that the Commonwealth declare the algal bloom a "national disaster", a senior bureaucrat has told a parliamentary inquiry — despite a state minister "advocating" for such a response three months ago.

item.title: Audit reveals widespread public housing electrical issues in wake of three-year-old's tragic death
item.description: The death of a three-year-old boy in an Alice Springs house fire has led to an electrical audit of Northern Territory public housing, which uncovered widespread issues affecting hundreds of homes, an inquest has heard.

item.title: Grieving Canberra dog owner warns of deadly blue-green algae but testing shows no increased risk
item.description: Toxic algae is sometimes detected in Canberra's waterways, where a dog died after swimming.

item.title: Jordan Spencer jailed for 13 years for setting woman alight
item.description: A 34-year-old Shepparton woman has been jailed for 13 years after dousing another woman with petrol and setting her on fire during a dispute over an e-scooter.
